alert.note: Alert for Cass; Richland (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 23 at 12:42PM CDT until April 27 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Dakota... Sheyenne River Diversion at West Fargo affecting Cass County. Sheyenne River near Kindred affecting Richland and Cass Counties. .Red River basin river flooding to continue. New snowmelt will result in slower gradual recession of some tributaries, with the possibility for secondary lower rises at some locations. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sheyenne River near Kindred. * WHEN...Until Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Portions of 55th St SE are underwater. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 18.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:00 PM CDT Sunday was 19.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning and continue falling to 15.6 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
